main event: In December 1958, a series of alleged UFO sightings and photographs related to unidentified objects on the moon were documented in Washington, D.C.
interesting points: The document refers to 'Blilast-offs' and 'pillars of fire' observed on the moon, which were concluded to be possibly astronomical or meteorological in nature., The analysis of the photographs indicated poor quality and questioned their authenticity., Major Friend interacted with an individual who claimed to have developed a technique for capturing images of these phenomena., A specific event on December 7, 1958, involved a large oval-shaped object that remained stationary in the sky before disappearing., Reports from Soviet astronomers corroborated the sightings, with mentions of bright flashes on the lunar surface.
sighted object: unidentified flying objects or phenomena possibly on the moon
witness description: Major Friend of the Aerial Phenomena Group, Air Science Division, visited for analysis.
